com.gembox.spreadsheet

Class SortState

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gembox.spreadsheet.SortState

  • public final class SortState
extends Object
    Represents sort settings and provides sort functionality.

    Use CellRange.sort(boolean) method to create or get a SortState instance.

    Active SortState is stored in the parent worksheet (ExcelWorksheet.getSort()) and is loaded from and saved to XLSX file.

    Following methods shows various ways to specify and apply a SortState to a range of cells. 
    
 public static void sort1(ExcelWorksheet worksheet) {
     // Specify and apply Sort using less-verbose, fluent, but less understandable interface.
     worksheet.getCells().getSubrange("A1", "D20").sort(true).
         by(0).
         by(1, true).
         by(2, "Female", "Male").
         apply();
 }

 public static void sort2(ExcelWorksheet worksheet) {
     // Specify and apply Sort using more verbose, but more understandable interface.
     SortState sort = worksheet.getCells().getSubrange("A1", "D20").sort(true);

     sort.getLevels().add(0);

     SortLevel level2 = sort.getLevels().add(1);
     level2.setDescending(true);

     SortLevel level3 = sort.getLevels().add(2);
     level3.setCustomList("Female", "Male");

     sort.apply();
 }
    See Also:
    Excel Sorting example

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public void apply()
        Performs the sorting of this range based on this SortState settings.

        Hidden (ExcelColumnRowBase.isHidden() is true) rows (or columns, if isLeftToRight() is true) won't be sorted.

        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Sort range contains merged cells.

      • by

        public SortState by(int columnRowIndex)
        Adds a SortLevel applied to a column (or a row, if isLeftToRight() is true) with the specified index (relative to the range).
        Parameters:
        columnRowIndex - The index of a column (or a row, if isLeftToRight() is true) relative to the range that an added SortLevel applies to.
        Returns:
        This SortState to specify additional sort levels or to apply sort.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - columnRowIndex is less than zero or is equal to or greater than width (or height, if isLeftToRight() is true) of the range.
        IllegalArgumentException - Column/row at the specified index is being sorted by the same criteria more than once. Delete the duplicate sort criteria and try again.

      • by

        public SortState by(int columnRowIndex,
                    boolean descending)
        Adds a SortLevel applied to a column (or a row, if isLeftToRight() is true) with the specified index (relative to the range) and with the specified order to sort by.
        Parameters:
        columnRowIndex - The index of a column (or a row, if isLeftToRight() is true) relative to the range that an added SortLevel applies to.
        descending - true to sort the values in the descending order; otherwise, false.
        Returns:
        This SortState to specify additional sort levels or to apply sort.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - columnRowIndex is less than zero or is equal to or greater than width (or height, if isLeftToRight() is true) of the range.
        IllegalArgumentException - Column/row at the specified index is being sorted by the same criteria more than once. Delete the duplicate sort criteria and try again.

      • by

        Parameters:
        columnRowIndex - The index of a column (or a row, if isLeftToRight() is true) relative to the range that an added SortLevel applies to.
        descending - true to sort the values in the descending order; otherwise, false.
        customList - The custom list by which order of items to sort by.
        Returns:
        This SortState to specify additional sort levels or to apply sort.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - columnRowIndex is less than zero or is equal to or greater than width (or height, if isLeftToRight() is true) of the range.
        IllegalArgumentException - Column/row at the specified index is being sorted by the same criteria more than once. Delete the duplicate sort criteria and try again.

      • isCaseSensitive

        public boolean isCaseSensitive()

        Gets a value indicating whether the sort is case-sensitive.

        Default value is false.

        Returns:
        true if the sort is case-sensitive; otherwise, false.

      • isLeftToRight

        public boolean isLeftToRight()

        Gets a value indicating whether to sort from left to right (whether to sort columns instead of rows).

        Default value is false.

        Returns:
        true to sort from left to right (to sort columns); otherwise, false to sort from top to bottom (to sort rows).

      • setCaseSensitive

        public void setCaseSensitive(boolean caseSensitive)

        Sets a value indicating whether the sort is case-sensitive.

        Default value is false.

        Parameters:
        caseSensitive - true if the sort is case-sensitive; otherwise, false.

      • setLeftToRight

        public void setLeftToRight(boolean value)

        Sets a value indicating whether to sort from left to right (whether to sort columns instead of rows).

        Default value is false.

        Parameters:
        value - true to sort from left to right (to sort columns); otherwise, false to sort from top to bottom (to sort rows).
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Sorting columns is not supported for the current sort state.

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Returns a String that represents this SortState instance.

        This method should be used primarily for debugging purposes and should be considered volatile (format of its return value might change in future versions).

        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        A String that represents this SortState instance.
